name: Science and Technology in Japan (Fall)
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
textbook:
M. Low, S. Nakayama and H. Yoshioka, Science, Technology and Society in Contemporary Japan, (Cambridge University Press, 1999).
(*) Students need not buy this textbook.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
Submission of a Term Essay:
Choose one topic which relates to any chapter of the textbook (including the remaining chapters of the textbook which could not be read in the classes). Then, refer to a third party author(s) who discuss(es) the same topic. Finally, starting with the arguments of this third party author(s), develop your own opinion on the topic.

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail:
Attendance is of great importance.
As for the reading assignments, the students who are assigned must read the section(s) in advance, and be ready to answer the questions from the lecturer as well as from other students.
(However, students are not required to make presentation about the assigned section(s). They have only to be ready to answer questions.)
At the end of each class, students must fill in the Feedback Comment Sheet.

students are required to select a certain Japanese S&T, to describe it briefly and to give one's own evaluation drawing on evidences or other persons' arguments.

At the end of each class, students must fill in the Feedback Comment Sheet.
